concept_data.title: Ecowas
concept_data.preferred_term: Economic Community of West African States

summary: The "Economic Community of West African States" (ECOWAS) is a pivotal regional organization established to promote economic integration and cooperation among its member states in West Africa. As a significant entity within the framework of extra-European organisations, ECOWAS plays a crucial role in fostering political stability, economic development, and regional security. The EU engages with ECOWAS through various legal and regulatory frameworks, facilitating trade agreements and development aid. This relationship underscores the EU's commitment to supporting regional organizations that enhance cooperation and stability, reflecting a broader strategy of international partnership and collaboration in addressing global challenges.
